function.name: astronomy
function.description: Complete astronomy calculations using Skyfield (100% local, no API key required). Planet positions, moon phases, ephemeris, celestial events, ISS tracking, physical data of solar system bodies. High precision NASA JPL ephemeris data.

operation.description: Operation: planet_position (positions of planets/sun/moon), moon_phase (current lunar phase), sun_moon_times (rise/set times), celestial_events (eclipses/conjunctions), planet_info (physical characteristics), visible_planets (tonight's visible planets), iss_position (International Space Station), star_position (star coordinates)

body.description: Celestial body for planet_position, planet_info operations

latitude.description: Observer latitude in degrees (e.g., 48.8566 for Paris)

longitude.description: Observer longitude in degrees (e.g., 2.3522 for Paris)

elevation.description: Observer elevation in meters (default: 0 = sea level)

date.description: Date/time for calculations (ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS or YYYY-MM-DD). Default: now (UTC)

days.description: Number of days for celestial_events or visible_planets operations (default: 7, max: 30)

horizon.description: Horizon angle in degrees for twilight calculations (0=geometric, -6=civil, -12=nautical, -18=astronomical). Default: -6 (civil twilight)
